hanzi-su-wiki:
墾

Значения

Поднимать целину, обрабатывать землю

Мнемоника

Обращать взор 艮 к целине и рыхлить почву 土, как свинья 豕. Землепашествовать. Примечание: знак 豸 использован вместо элемента «свинья».

Варианты

垦
purpleculture_pinyin:
kěn
to reclaim (land); to cultivate
вернуть (землю); культивировать

(Simplified: 垦)
Pictophonetic: 貇 indicates the sound; 土 (earth) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
墾荒 [ kěn huāng ]: to open up land (for agriculture)
墾殖 [ kěn zhí ]: to open up land for cultivation
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 貇 [ kūn ] to bite, to gnaw
    • 土 [ tǔ ] soil, earth; items made of earth
heisig_chinese_memo: It was the reclaiming of the new farm, but there was an uninvited guest to the ceremony. It was a famous skunk, the one with the familiar silver stripe. The feet of the crowd rushing from the ceremony site churned up the soil very nicely. The ceremony was ruined but the reclaiming was a great success.
heisig_constituent: groundbreaking, skunk, silver, soil, dirt, ground
heisig_story: The groundbreaking referred to here is not for the erection of new buildings but for the opening of farmlands. The elements: skunk . . . silver . . . soil.
koohiiStory1: It was the groundbreaking of the new farm, but there was an uninvited guest to the ceremony. It was a famous skunk, the one with the familiar silver stripe. The feet of the crowd rushing from the ceremony site churned up the soil very nicely. The ceremony was ruined but the groundbreaking was a great success.
koohiiStory2: I got sprayed by a skunk, so no one is helping me with the groundbreaking of my farm. On a positive note, I found silver laying all over the soil. Mine all mine!

Kanshudo_mnemonic: a good badger (貇) on the ground (土) would be groundbreaking
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The king came with knights in silver armor to reclaim his land.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The character form of Xiaozhuan starts from " earth ", and the sound is "豤". The form of the Likai font is from " earth ", "貇" sound. "豤" is the same as "豇". The original meaning is plowing. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Cultivation, farming. From the soil, the sound." Such as "Guan Zi. "Governing the country": "Civil farming leads to land cultivation, land cultivation leads to more corn, and more corn leads to the wealth of the country. The wealthy of the country will make the country stronger, the strong soldier will win, and the winner will have a lot of land." "Han Feizi. "Xianxue": "Today's merchants and officials do not cultivate but eat, but the land does not cultivate, and they are consistent with the rock."

" Reclamation " also refers to development and reclamation. Such as "Mandarin. Zhou Yushang": "If the soil is not cultivated, it is built in a division." Wei Zhao's note: "Reclamation, send it." "Han Shu. "Shihuo Zhi": "If the rate is more people, there will be 30 skips a day, and the less will be thirteen skips, and the old land will be cultivated.

" Ken " also means injury. Such as "Zhou Li. Kao Gong Ji.旊人": "Anything about Taohu will not enter the market." Zheng Xuan's note: "Yu is pronounced as scraping. Reclamation, stubborn injury. Fructus, rupture. Violent, the grave will not be firm." It means that any pottery utensils that are skewed, damaged, cracked, or protruding, cannot be placed on the market.
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The character form of "Xiaozhuan" starts from "土" with the sound of "豤". The form of the Likai font is from " earth ", "貇" sound. The original meaning is plowing and farming, and also refers to opening up cultivated land.
humanum_full_description:
小篆字形從「土」，「豤」聲。隸楷字形從「土」，「貇」聲。「豤」同「貇」。本義是翻土耕作。《說文新附》：「墾，耕也。从土，豤聲。」如《管子．治國》：「民事農則田墾，田墾則粟多，粟多則國富，國富者兵彊，兵彊者戰勝，戰勝者地廣。」《韓非子．顯學》：「今商官技藝之士，亦不墾而食，是地不墾，與磐石一貫也。」

　　「墾」又指開闢、開墾。如《國語．周語上》：「土不備墾，辟在有司。」韋昭注：「墾，發也。」《漢書．食貨志》：「率多人者田日三十畮，少者十三畮，以故田多墾闢。」

　　「墾」還表示損傷。如《周禮．考工記．旊人》：「凡陶瓬之事，髺墾薜暴，不入市。」鄭玄注：「髺讀為刮。墾，頓傷也。薜，破裂也。暴，墳起不堅致也。」意謂凡燒製陶器器皿，器物形體歪邪、損傷、破裂、突出不平的都不能放到市場上。
humanum_short_description: 小篆字形從「土」，「豤」聲。隸楷字形從「土」，「貇」聲。本義是翻土耕作，又指開闢耕地。

小篆字形從「 土 」，「 豤 」聲。隸楷字形從「 土 」，「 貇 」聲。「 豤 」同「 貇 」。本義是翻土耕作。《說文新附》：「墾，耕也。从土，豤聲。」如《管子．治國》：「民事農則田墾，田墾則粟多，粟多則國富，國富者兵彊，兵彊者戰勝，戰勝者地廣。」《韓非子．顯學》：「今商官技藝之士，亦不墾而食，是地不墾，與磐石一貫也。」 「 墾 」又指開闢、開墾。如《國語．周語上》：「土不備墾，辟在有司。」韋昭注：「墾，發也。」《漢書．食貨志》：「率多人者田日三十畮，少者十三畮，以故田多墾闢。」 「 墾 」還表示損傷。如《周禮．考工記．旊人》：「凡陶瓬之事，髺墾薜暴，不入市。」鄭玄注：「髺讀為刮。墾，頓傷也。薜，破裂也。暴，墳起不堅致也。」意謂凡燒製陶器器皿，器物形體歪邪、損傷、破裂、突出不平的都不能放到市場上。

The original meaning is plowing. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Cultivation, farming. From the soil, the sound." Such as "Guan Zi. "Governing the country": "Civil farming leads to land cultivation, land cultivation leads to more corn, and more corn leads to the wealth of the country. The wealthy of the country will make the country stronger, the strong soldier will win, and the winner will have a lot of land." "Han Feizi. "Xianxue": "Today's merchants and officials do not cultivate but eat, but the land does not cultivate, and they are consistent with the rock." " Reclamation" also refers to development and reclamation. Such as "Mandarin. Zhou Yushang": "If the soil is not cultivated, it is built in a division." Wei Zhao's note: "Reclamation, send it." "Han Shu. "Shihuo Zhi": "If the rate is more people, there will be 30 skips a day, and the less will be thirteen skips, and the old land will be cultivated. " Ken" also means injury. Such as "Zhou Li. Kao Gong Ji.旊人": "Anything about Taohu will not enter the market." Zheng Xuan's note: "Yu is pronounced as scraping. Reclamation, stubborn injury. Fructus, rupture. Violent, the grave will not be firm." It means that any pottery utensils that are skewed, damaged, cracked, or protruding, cannot be placed on the market.

墾字的基本解释

墾
kěn
见“垦”。

墾字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kěn］
［《廣韻》康很切，上很，溪。］
“垦1”的繁体字。
(1)开垦；翻耕。
(2)损伤。

墾字的康熙字典解释

【丑集中】【土字部】　墾； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页240第03
【廣韻】康很切【集韻】【韻會】口很切，?音懇。力治也。一曰開田用力反土也。　又傷也，如鉏墾之傷物也。【周禮·冬官考工記旊人】陶旊之事，髻墾薛暴不入市。【註】旊人，摶埴之工。髻，薄也。墾，傷也。薛，破裂也。暴，暴起也。皆器之不任用者，故不令其入市。　又叶苦泫切，音犬。【蘇軾·垂雲亭詩】我詩久不作，荒澀旋鉏墾。從君覓佳句，咀嚼廢朝飯。飯音卞上聲。
